results.title: The Man who had no dream
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Animated story based on the book by Adelaide Holl about an idle man who discovers meaning in his life through activity and caring for others. Narrated by Jacques Aubuchon. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Churchill Films

results.title: Hug me
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Bosustow Entertainment and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: An animated story of a lonely porcupine who wants a friend to hug him more than anything else in the world, but who is shunned by the other animals. He eventually finds such a friend in the forest. Based on the book “Hug me” by Patti Stren.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow, Bosustow Entertainment and Churchill Films

results.brief_description: Encourages children to be aware of the danger inherent in slovenly habits in the kitchen, in care of their clothing, and in personal hygiene.

results.title: Reflecting on the moon
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff, Lothar Wolff Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Explains why the moon’s surface is pitted and notes the conditions there that make it unsuitable for human habitation. Notes the cycle of the moon in relation to the earth, and introduces the concept of gravity through footage of the 1969 American landing. Suitable for upper primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lothar Wolff, Lothar Wolff Productions and National Geographic Society

results.title: Plants make food. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: An elementary film using animation, photomicrography and live-action experiments on photosynthesis showing how plants make food. Explains the functioning of roots, stems and leaves and explains the transforming of water, minerals and carbon dioxide into foods. Also covers the roles of chlorophyll and sunlight. Suitable for upper primary level.
results.description: An elementary film using animation, photomicrography and live-action experiments on photosynthesis showing how plants make food. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Human nervous system
results.creator_credit: John McDonald, Robert Churchill and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Shows the differences and similarities between simple animals and humans to explain the role of the nervous system. Also studies the structure of the brain and its complexity. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Future
results.brief_description: Approaches the possibilities for life in the future through three distinct scenarios a world reached through technological developments, a world of economic, social and ecological collapse, and a world where the possibility of solving our problems and surviving becomes apparent

results.title: A Curiouse and diverse flora. Pt. 4: change and survival
results.creator_credit: Australian Academy of Science and CSIRO
